result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Earl Gardner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /s/ RJS 07/07/16 - request for payment of attorney fee's in the amount of $289.09
Request to have outstanding bond monies applied to other cases

Defendant Darnell Earl Gardner in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM452, 15CT309 & 15CT310.

2:57 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Knaapen states that the defendant now has a valid DL.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM452:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

15CT309:
Count 1 - No contest 

15CT310:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CT309 and Count 1, 2 & 3 of 15CM452 are DRI and Count 1 of 15CT310 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM452:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

15CT309:
Count 1 -
*Pay fine of $300 plus costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Provide a DNA Sample
*Bond monies from 15CM452 to be applied to the fine/costs
*60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 

15CT310:
Count 1 - DRI
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Order for Appointment of Atty Schmidt at repayment of $75 per month
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order /s/RJS 11-30-15 Granted - Atty Karl Schmidt - repayment $75/month
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Court allows Defendant 30 days to post the bond. Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Darnell Earl Gardner in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:57 AM Court calls case and states appearances.

Defendant is now present.

Address is verified.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is vacated.

Defendant was present, but in the wrong courtroom.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant received a copy of the complaint.

Court informs Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.
Defendant would like counsel.
Defendant works.

Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY, not waiving time limits.

State addresses bond, recommends $300 cash bond with conditions.

Defendant addresses the bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Darnell Earl Gardner not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:07 AM Court calls case.
Defendant does not appear.

Court reviews file.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a criminal warrant with a $500 cash alternative.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and Defendant committed it.
